tumor_size_max_dimension.evidence: The tumor size is stated as 2.5 cm in the report. The estimated value is based on the rounded up value of the tumor size in centimeters as per AJCC 7th edition guidelines.

pT.evidence: The T stage is stated as T2 in the report. Based on the AJCC 7th edition guidelines, the estimated T stage is T2a.

pN.evidence: The pN stage is stated as N0 in the report. There is no evidence to suggest nodal involvement therefore the estimated pN stage is also N0.

tumor_stage.evidence: The tumor stage is stated as Stage IV in the report. Based on the AJCC 7th edition guidelines, the estimated tumor stage is also Stage IV.

histologic_diagnosis.evidence: The histological diagnosis is stated as Lung Adenocarcinoma in the report. There is no evidence to suggest otherwise therefore the estimated diagnosis is also Lung Adenocarcinoma.

comment: The tumor classification as adenocarcinoma of the lung showing a predominantly tubulopapillary structural pattern still requires confirmation by appropriate immunohistochemical analysis. The classification of the second small tumor focus as a (hematogenous) metastasis that – despite a certain difference in histoarchitecture and cell morphology in places – is based on the structure of the focus, which is lacking the fibrous remodeling or cicatricial zone here that is characteristic of a primary peripheral bronchopulmonary carcinoma.
